short_summary: DND seeks RFI responses to determine interest in providing residential investment opportunities at CFB Kingston.
description: DFN is looking for expression of interest to acquire up to 60 units with option to buy undeveloped land in Kingston. Expression of interest will inform and support potential future bidding opportunities.
full_summary:
# Canadian Forces Base Kingston, ON: Request for Information for Residential Investment Opportunities

## Request for Information Overview

The Department of National Defence (DND) is inviting interested parties to respond to this Request for Information (RFI) regarding residential investment opportunities at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Kingston, ON. This RFI is not a bid solicitation and is non-binding.

## Purpose and Objectives

The purpose of this RFI is to determine potential interest and opportunities in supporting the DND in its residential investment activities. The objective is to gather information from potential contractors to inform future bidding opportunities, including contract scope.

## Background

The DND is seeking to acquire up to 60 housing units within the geographic boundary identified in Annex A. Undeveloped land is also available for consideration, as detailed in Annex B. The acquired housing units and/or constructed residential housing will support the DND's activities at CFB Kingston.

## Submission Requirements

Firms interested in providing residential investment services are invited to submit their responses to the RFI by email to [Steve.Kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:Steve.Kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca) by the closing date and time indicated on the Electronic Bidding System.

## Procurement and Trade Agreements

The procurement will be conducted in accordance with the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). Goods and services subject to tender will be open to North American Indigenous Business and Economic Development Corporations (NIBDC) and will prioritize Canadian content.

## Important Considerations

* The DND reserves the right to cancel or modify the procurement without further notice.
* Expenses incurred in responding to this RFI will not be reimbursed.
* This RFI does not create a source list, and respondents may not be precluded from participating in future procurement opportunities.

## Contact and Additional Information

For questions and any further information regarding this RFI, please contact: Steve Kennedy, Technical Specialist, Procurement, Defence Construction Canada. You can also visit the MERX website [www.merx.com](http://www.merx.com) for more information and to download the related documents. Please note fees may apply.
